column4: my computer is randomly freezing after some use - is there anyway to find out what is the culprit through ubuntu - or whether it is maybe some driver in ubntu?
issues like that will never have a general solution
i know and its making me sad, but maybe i can start by looking at some logs or running some commands to see what the computer was trying to do before freezing?
does it freeze using linux only?
haven't tested windows
and how does it freeze

its the purest freeze you could imagine, i am would working on something then the mouse and keyboard and OS stop responding, the image freezes wherever it was at - there are no sounds or msg's or anything
hmm ever tried booting the machine console based? could the crash relate to video driver issues?
i would love to be able to test that out, thing is i cant reliably reproduce it without just using it for like 10 mins
is that a clue?
i cant tell but i'd try "text mode"
maybe i should call geek squad :-0
is there some obvious things i can look for in the logs?
ifconfig?
internal meaning?
i was thinking the system logs... how would ifconfig help
sry i read the wrong line!
heh
you on an apache issue or do i mix up things?
i'm the guy whose computer randomly freezes after a random amount of use :)
sorry :)
got distracted and the alc guy is starting to take over again.
